option.description: The file (or files) that contain the coordinates and parameters of the molecule(s) to be simulated.
Provide details about any protein molecules in the simulation. Protein molecules are those that are comprised of multiple residues, with z-matricies assigned using a template file.
Provide details about any solute molecules in the simulation. Solute molecules tend to be smaller molecules, comprising only a few residues, that are moved automatically using "flex" files.

The identities of the molecules in each file that should be ignored. Molecules that are not assigned as protein or solute molecules are automatically added as solvent molecules. To stop this, you have to list molecules that should be ignored. For example, to ignore all unassigned molecules in the second file you would set ignore_molecules = "file:2,molecules:[all]". To ignore the first, third and tenth molecules in the first file, you would set ignore_molecules = "file:1,molecules:[1,3,10]". To ignore all but the first five molecules in the first file and all of the molecules in the second file you would set ignore_molecules = "file:1,molecules:[6:] file:2,molecules:[all]"
The simulation temperature.

option.name: pressure
option.description: The simulation pressure. If you set the pressure, then an NPT (constant temperature, constant pressure) will be performed. If you don't set a pressure, then an NVT (canonical, constant temperature, constant volume) simulation will be performed.
The list of molecules whose movement should be completely synchronised.
The list of molecules that should be translated together.
The list of molecules that should be rotated together.
The list of molecules that should have synchronised intramolecular moves.
Control exactly what should be performed during a simulation.
Set the number of moves in the simulation. Monitors will be active during this moves.
Add a block of equilibration. Monitors are not active during equilibration.
Set the number of moves of equilibration.
Add a block of simulation. Monitors are active during simulation blocks.
Set the number of moves of simulation.
Add monitors that may be used to follow properties of the simulation, e.g. the energy and coordinate trajectory
Add monitors for energy interactions involving solute molecules.
Add a monitor that records the average energy between the solute and all protein residues within a cutoff distance of the solute (as calculated at the start of the simulation).
The identity of the solute molecule that you wish to monitor.
The cutoff distance used to generate the list of interacting residues.
Set the frequency with which this monitor is updated.
Add a monitor that records the average energy between the solute and all solvent molecules that are identified by the identity points tied to the specified solute atoms.
The identity of the solute molecule that you wish to monitor.
The names of the atoms in the solute to which identity points will be attached.
Set the frequency with which this monitor is updated.
Add a monitor that records the instantaneous value of all of the energy components of the system.
Set the frequency with which this monitor is updated.
Add a monitor that records the coordinates of atoms, or selected atoms in the system, during the simulation.
Set the frequency with which this monitor is updated.
The random number seed used to initialise the random number generators used during the simulation.
